hours_text:
## Hours

**Hours:** 10 AM – 4 PM, Tuesday – Sunday

Seymour Marine Discovery Center  
100 McAllister Way  
Santa Cruz, CA 95060

## Admission

Tickets are non-refundable and are valid for general admission during regular operating hours. Children 2 and under, UCSC students and members get free admission. Show your receipt at the front desk for admission.

## Behind-the-Scene Daily Tours: 11 AM, 1 PM, 2 PM, 3 PM

_Daily tours are included with admission and are**filled on a first-come, first-served basis**. Online ticket purchases do not guarantee access to a tour. _

Join our skilled volunteer docents on a 30-minute tour around the Seymour Center and parts of the Long Marine Lab. Come face-to-face with our blue whale skeleton and travel to an overlook to see where and how marine mammal research happens at UC Santa Cruz. Daily tours are included with admission and are filled on a first-come, first-served basis (space is limited to 20 participants). All participants must be present to sign up. Sign-ups begin one hour before the tour starts, at the admission desk. To ensure a wonderful experience for all our visitors, we limit tour passes to groups of 9 or fewer. Thank you for understanding!

**Coming with a large group(10+ people)? Please go to our[Group visits](https://seymourcenter.ucsc.edu/visit/groups-and-tours/) page to learn more and book a visit.**

**Coming with a school group? Visit our[School field trips](https://seymourcenter.ucsc.edu/visit/school-programs/) page fo...

accessibility_text:
## ADA Compliance Office

## About the ADA Compliance Office

The UC Santa Cruz ADA Compliance Office is housed in the [Office of Equity and Equal Protection](http://equity.ucsc.edu) (EEP). EEP is a compliance office that includes Title IX, EEO, ADA, and Whistleblower complaint processes. Co-locating these compliance units together helps prevent issues from falling through the cracks and allows the EEP team to track trends and more effectively implement prevention efforts. 

The ADA Compliance Office is made up of the ADA Compliance Officer and the ADA Compliance Coordinator. You can learn more about these roles on the “Contact” page. Supporting access on our campus is the responsibility of everyone and many offices collaborate to support the five program access areas. The ADA Compliance Office provides direct service to campus by supporting public access requests, overseeing all five program access areas, managing escalated issues and engaging in proactive efforts to improve campus accessibility. 

## Commitment to Access and Program Access Areas

UC policy prohibits discrimination on the basis of disability. UCSC’s compliance with the ADA is overseen by the ADA Compliance Officer housed in [Equity and Equal Protection](http://equity.ucsc.edu). Accessibility is managed through five program access areas and complaints about failure to accommodate for faculty, staff, students, and community members are managed by the EEO Office under the University of California Anti-Discrimin...
collections_text:
Spend your day with us

**Touch a shark!**  
Start the day off right by holding a friendly hermit crab, snapping a cute photo at our new jelly tank, and touching a shark. Our incredible volunteers create a space for you and your family that teaches conservation through human connection.  

**Hop on a 30-minute tour**  
Join our friendly and knowledgeable volunteer docents on outdoor tour to experience spectacular coastal views and discover why science matters. Come early to secure your tour, they fill up quickly!  

**Enjoy your lunch on the bluff**  
Step outside, put on some sunscreen, and enjoy your lunch on a bench. Be on the lookout for pelicans, otters, and whales. If you still have time, and the kiddos are feeling up to it, enjoy the short 1 mile loop around the UC Santa Cruz’s Coastal Campus.

[See More Experiences](https://seymourcenter.science.ucsc.edu/visit/exhibits/)

Photo Credit: Shmuel Thaler, Santa Cruz Sentinel
